properties.Situation_Snapshot: On 18 Feb 2026, Africa CDC reported two cases of Crimean-Congo haemorrhagic fever: a 7-year-old child from Tambacounda region in Senegal and a 21-year-old nurse from Kyankwanzi District, Uganda. Both cases tested PCR-positive in late January. Sporadic CCHF cases occur in Senegal and Uganda, and there is no evidence of established Hyalomma tick populations in the UK【301919499951224†L118-L146】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid tick bites by using insect repellents and wearing protective clothing in rural areas. Avoid contact with animal blood or tissues and practise good hygiene. There is no vaccine for CCHF; post-exposure prophylaxis may be recommended for high-risk exposures.

properties.Situation_Snapshot: On 14 Feb 2026, Cambodia reported its first human case of avian influenza A(H5N1) of 2026 in Meanrith village, Kampot province. The case cooked and ate a dead chicken three days before symptom onset and recovered after receiving treatment. Close contacts received oseltamivir prophylaxis【315196092635405†L118-L134】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid contact with sick or dead birds. Ensure poultry and eggs are thoroughly cooked. Maintain strict hygiene after handling poultry. Seek medical advice if experiencing flu-like symptoms after exposure.

properties.Location_Label: Cases detected in UK and India
properties.Situation_Snapshot: WHO reported two mpox cases with a recombinant strain combining clade Ib and clade IIb in the UK and India. The UK case, detected in December 2025, involved a traveler to South-East Asia; whole genome sequencing showed clade Ib and IIb elements. The Indian case was reclassified as recombinant after initial clade IIb classification. No secondary cases were identified【315196092635405†L143-L166】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Practice safe sex and avoid close contact with individuals showing mpox symptoms. Vaccination is advised for at-risk groups. Follow health authority guidance and monitor for updates on this recombinant strain.

properties.Situation_Snapshot: On 6 Feb 2026, WHO reported a fatal Nipah virus case in Rajshahi Division, Bangladesh. The patient consumed raw date palm sap, developed symptoms on 21 Jan 2026 and died on 28 Jan 2026. 35 contacts were identified, including six symptomatic contacts who tested negative. Earlier in January 2026, two Nipah cases were reported in healthcare workers in West Bengal, India【830300979064317†L118-L148】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid raw date palm sap and contact with bats or pigs. Practice good hygiene and avoid exposure to sick people. Seek medical care if you develop fever or neurological symptoms after travel to affected areas.

properties.Location_Label: Multiple regions, Madagascar; travellers to Comoros
properties.Situation_Snapshot: Health authorities in Madagascar declared an outbreak of mpox (clade Ib) on 31 Dec 2025 after detecting the first case on 17 Dec 2025. As of 1 Feb 2026, 410 mpox cases (including 229 confirmed) had been reported across 23 regions; most confirmed cases (167) were in Boeny. Since week 4, there has been an increase of 47 confirmed cases. Comoros reported nine mpox cases linked to travel from Madagascar【651899418754260†L118-L136】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid close physical contact with individuals with mpox-like symptoms. Practice safe sex and maintain hand hygiene. Vaccination is recommended for men who have sex with men with multiple partners and for people at occupational risk.

properties.Location_Label: Central Argentina (Buenos Aires, Entre Ríos, Santa Fe)
properties.Situation_Snapshot: Between 30 Jun 2025 and 10 Jan 2026, Argentina reported at least 58 confirmed hantavirus infections with 20 deaths, primarily in the central provinces (Buenos Aires, Entre Ríos, Santa Fe). This exceeds previous seasonal peaks【651899418754260†L118-L136】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid exposure to rodent-infested areas, especially in rural or periurban settings. Ensure accommodation is rodent-proof, and store food properly. Seek medical attention if you develop fever, muscle aches and respiratory symptoms after exposure.

properties.Situation_Snapshot: A confirmed case of Argentine haemorrhagic fever (Junin virus) was reported on 16 Jan 2026 in Santa Fe, Argentina. The disease is endemic in the Pampas provinces (Buenos Aires, Córdoba, Santa Fe, La Pampa) with most cases during the harvest season. Rodent exposure is the main risk【651899418754260†L118-L136】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid exposure to rodents and rodent-contaminated environments in endemic areas. Use personal protective equipment during agricultural work. There is a vaccine (Candid #1) available in Argentina for high-risk populations.

properties.Situation_Snapshot: From 9 to 15 Jan 2026, three human infections with avian influenza A(H9N2) were reported in China: a 5-year-old boy in Hubei, an 8-year-old girl in Jiangsu and a 1-year-old boy in Guangxi. All had exposure to backyard poultry or live poultry markets and recovered【315196092635405†L118-L134】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid contact with live or dead poultry and birds. Follow food safety guidelines and maintain personal hygiene. Consult a healthcare provider about seasonal influenza vaccination before travel.

properties.Location_Label: Various regions, Saudi Arabia; imported cases in France
properties.Situation_Snapshot: As of 3 Feb 2026, no new MERS cases have been reported since the previous update on 5 Jan 2026. There have been 2,647 MERS cases and 959 deaths worldwide since April 2012, but no cases reported in 2026【185441389595651†L121-L130】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid contact with camels and camel products in the Middle East. Practise strict hygiene (hand washing) and avoid unpasteurised milk or undercooked camel meat. Seek medical advice if you develop fever, cough or shortness of breath after travel to affected regions.

properties.Situation_Snapshot: Ethiopia declared an end to the Marburg virus disease outbreak on 26 Jan 2026 after two incubation periods without new cases. The outbreak involved 19 cases (14 confirmed and 5 probable) and 14 deaths. 857 contacts were monitored and public health measures were implemented to contain the outbreak【651899418754260†L147-L158】.
properties.Travel_Health_Takeaways: Avoid contact with bats, caves and bushmeat. Practise strict hygiene and avoid contact with bodily fluids of infected individuals. Seek immediate medical care if you experience fever, headache, muscle pain or bleeding after travel to affected regions.
